course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Organic Chemistry II
course.description: Continuation of CHEM 2110.  Dienes, resonance and aromaticity; electrophilic aromatic substitution and nucleophilic aromatic substitution; benzylic and allylic reactivity; the chemistry of carbonyl compounds and carboxylic acid derivatives; the chemistry of amines; pericyclic reactions.

reviews.author: cabbi
reviews.title: Responsible and enthusiastic teacher
reviews.comment_content:
1.IR and MS spectroscopy
2.NMR (1H NMR,13 C NMR)
3.Conjugated compounds and UV Spectroscopy
4.Benzene and aromaticity
5.Electrophilic aromatic substitution
6.Carbonyl compounds: nucleophilic acyl substitution, alpha substitution, carbonyl condensation
7.amine and amides
8.pericyclic reaction mechanism
reviews.comment_teaching:
Excellent teaching. Very enthusiastic and patient teacher. Responds to students questions both in class and after class timely. Makes good use of awesome youtube videos to help illustrate concepts and deepen impression. I strongly regret not having paid enough attention to him during the lectures..

For chem minors who want to learn about ochem this is great course
reviews.comment_grading:
lenient
1 assignment 10%
1 quiz 20%
1 final 70%

final: full mark 300 , mean 89, high 244.5
assignment: full mark 100, mean 73, high 97
quiz: full mark 100, mean 43.7, high 85

I reckon to have performed equally horribly in both ochem 1 and 2, but grade in this course is better than ochem1
reviews.comment_workload: It depends. Suggested exercise and answers are provided for each chapter (which would probably take around 2 hours), but these are not compulsory. It wasnt until the end of the semester that the teacher modified the assessment scheme (previously only midterm and final are counted toward the final grade) into 1 assignment, 1 quiz and 1 final. I didnt start to try to catch up with the lesson until the first deadline approached (which was only 10 days away from final and already way too late) and it was horrible to have to cram for everything from scratch. Strongly advisable to follow the teacher and do the exercise on time. They could have done me great good if I did all of them..

reviews.author: 綿綿頭上飛花
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 12. Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy
Chapter 13. Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
Chapter 14. Conjugated Dienes and UV Spectroscopy
Chapter 15. Benzene and Aromaticity
Chapter 16. Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution
A Preview of Carbonyl Compounds
Chapter 19. Aldehydes/Ketones: Nucleophilic Addition Reaction
---Midterm----
Chapter 20. Carboxylic Acids and Nitriles
Chapter 21. Carboxylic Acid Derivatives: Nucleophilic Acyl Substitution Reactions
Chapter 22. Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions
Chapter 23. Carbonyl Condensation Reactions
Chapter 24. Amines and Heterocycles
Chapter 30. Orbitals and Organic Chemistry: Pericyclic reactions
-
I feel that the content for this course is less than CHEM2110, though I am not sure if it is because I got used to the ridiculous workload of orgchem courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think he teaches better than the prof of CHEM2110. At least he won't teach you 8x pages of slides in one lesson.  He talks really slow, no need to afraid that you won't be able to catch up. Also. he will tell you which chapter is important. I think this helps me when preparing for the exam.  Although he don't provide your feedback for midterm, he does explains the questions in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm examination, 40%
Final examination, 60%
-
Similar to CHEM2110 Org Chem I, there are no extra exercises given. But this course is better than CHEM2110 at least you have a sample midterm with solution. Other than that, all you have is the numerous textbook questions for you to do.

The examination mode is WAY BETTER than CHEM2110. There are MCs, short questions (fill in the product of given reaction etc), mechanism, spectroscopy and synthesis design. You still have chances to get some marks at MC if you are students like me who knows nothing about synthesis design. :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Hundred and thousand of reactions. Feels like remembering your lecture notes into your brain. Not a fan of orgchem so this course feels like hell for me.

Even though it is an online semester with an online exam, prof does not allow us to have an open book exam for both final and midterm. Meaning that you will need to remember all these reactions. Moreover, he does not allow you to go back to the previous questions during midterm and final... which is very annoying as you have to manage your time well.

reviews.author: No,Thankyou!
reviews.comment_content:
Direct copy from canvas page
Chapter 12. Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy
Chapter 13. Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
Chapter 14. Conjugated Dienes and UV Spectroscopy
Chapter 15. Benzene and Aromaticity
Chapter 16. Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution

Chapter 20. Carboxylic Acids and Nitriles

Chapter 22. Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions
Chapter 23. Carbonyl Condensation Reactions
Chapter 24. Amines and Heterocycles

1 tutorial class for revision

No attendance required. You can see lecture video after the class. (*this semester is online mode and zoom will automatically record it. I'm not sure whether face to face class will have lecture video or not.)

Organic chemistry is very difficult la. Every lesson I just sit in front of the computer and learn nothing.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor HUANG is very passionate in teaching. He is willing to answer the questions related to organic chemistry after the class or by email.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 10%
Online quiz (close book) 20%
Final exam (open book) 70%

Mean
Assignment 73/100
Online quiz 43.7/100
Final exam 89/300 (SD= 47.1)
overall mean ~36.81%

My grade
Assignment 72/100
Online quiz 35/100
Final exam 112/300
overall ~40.33%
Final grade = B+
I would say that the grading is very lenient. I think mean should have B.
reviews.comment_workload:
light work load.
This semester only have one assignment, one quiz, one final exam. Both assignment, quiz and final exam are cover all the topic in lectures.
After each chapter will have some assignment, but these are optional (no need to submit, just for practice). If you have time, you should have a try. These assignment are decided to help us understand better in this course.

reviews.author: cyc_yin
reviews.title: 我覺得易過org chem 1
reviews.comment_content: 最初講下D analytical方法判斷個org compound，呢個雖然考試有比圖，但一定要背下知下，考試必問。之後介紹返aromatic ring同carbonyl既reaction，因為今次唔似org chem 1咁，宜家各種reactions佢地都係同一系統既，所以易背D，同埋知道electrophilic／nucleophilic個D理論之後就明。考mt同fianl個陣要背個「鍊成陣」出黎，最好平時畫下。
reviews.comment_teaching: 無可否認孫耀威既ppt係好過標叔既，起碼mechanism詳細D，不過都係抄返書D圖，之後照讀。同埋講解都清楚既（<-如果你聽到佢微弱聲線既話），唔似標叔狂飛書skip steps，同埋最好坐前D。
reviews.comment_grading: Quiz係150分滿分，mt係350，fianl係500，D分加埋就係1000啦！/_>\  孫耀威佢話跟返總分排名黎比grade，我final高1SD，我總分有接近700分，排名應該頭10%，就有A－。
reviews.comment_workload: 無功課，但一樣你自己做下練習，寫notes，reaction paths同mechanism。重點係要睇返ppt同書重要／騎呢既mechanism，因為mt同final一定會考1-2條一模一樣既（判斷個org compound個度都係有條同書一樣既）。mt同final有基本1-3 steps reaction既攞分題，每個格6分咁加加埋埋都佔好多下。

reviews.author: bsbsbsbs
reviews.title: Midterms = 兵家必爭之地
reviews.comment_content: See from other comments, the contents won’t change much.
reviews.comment_teaching: I like Nakamura’s teaching style better. Professor Sun also did a pretty good job in teaching too. Don’t worry about the teaching if you’re being taught by these two professors.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 40% Final 60%

I don’t know if the A range is wider this year, but I heard that UST has been forcing the professors to narrow the A range.

My score
Midterm: 140/250 (highest: 250, mean: 123.7)
Final: 361/400 (highest: 384, mean: 180.8, sd: 92.88)
Overall: 76.5%
Letter grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
A lot of stuff to study, especially when you’re like me, not quite interested in org chem.

If you want A range, doing ALL chapter exercises is a must. And for Nakamura’s part in particular, he will present some very complicated problems(extracted from his own research work I guess) in class, try your best to understand those for they will appear in your finals, albeit not much.

Also prepare for your midterms as if it’s your finals. It is so important I can’t stress enough. Chasing with the final is so hard and so stressful.

reviews.author: Sonic12
reviews.title: Review of CHEM3120
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 12. Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy
Chapter 13. Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
Chapter 14. Conjugated Dienes and UV Spectroscopy
Chapter 15. Benzene and Aromaticity
Chapter 16. Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution
Chapter 19. Aldehydes/Ketones: Nucleophilic Addition Reaction
------------------- Mid-Term ---------------------------------
Chapter 20. Carboxylic Acids and Nitriles  
Chapter 21. Carboxylic Acid Derivatives: Nucleophilic Acyl  Substitution Reactions
Chapter 22. Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions
Chapter 23. Carbonyl Condensation Reactions
Chapter 24. Amines and Heterocycles
Chapter 30. Orbitals and Organic Chemistry: Pericyclic reactions
--------------- Final (Covering all chapters) ---------------

Just typical contents for organic chemistry II courses
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course is delivered by two professors, prof. Sun and prof. Hugh.

Professor Sun's lecture is a bit slow-paced, so sometimes it can be boring but he covers all the essential parts quite well. As the pace is slow, you have enough time to digest all the course contents.

Professor Hugh's lecture is somewhat fast-paced. He seems very enthusiastic about his research and teaching. Overall, not bad. However, he spends quite some time explaining total synthesis examples which I personally think is a bit waste of time as the examples are way too complicated for the undergraduate level, and most of all, not related to the exams.

Both professors have exclusive ppt slides (mainly example questions) which can be only seen in class. These slides are important in preparing for the exams so don't miss them.
reviews.comment_grading:
-Mid-term (40%)-
mean: 52/100      sd: 19

-Final (60%)-
mean: 147.2/320        sd: 72.87
High: 305
Low: 35

--My score--
Mid-term: 84/100
Final: 267/320

Overall grade: A

Seems the grading is fine and the exams were not that difficult (of course if you studied).
What I don't understand is such a high sd (72.87) for the final. The deviation shouldn't be that high because the exam was not that hard, much easy and merciful compared to the infamous organic chem I course.
Anyways, the data shows that the students are divided largely into two groups, ones are very good at org chem, and ones are very bad at org chem. If you want to get a good grade, you need to excel in this course, as you are competing with superb students for the A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only mid-term and final exams. Most of the reactions and mechanisms are related to each other, so relatively easy to grasp all the reaction concepts. The hard part would be the contents covering from chapter 12 to chapter 14 (spectroscopy). If you are first to spectroscopy, you might need to spend some time and get used to solving problems of these kinds.

Don't try to cram everything in the end. Study and practice ahead, then you'll be fine.

reviews.author: yo~
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 12. Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy
Chapter 13. Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
Chapter 14. Conjugated Dienes and UV Spectroscopy
Chapter 15. Benzene and Aromaticity
Chapter 16. Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution

Chapter 20. Carboxylic Acids and Nitriles  
Chapter 21. Carboxylic Acid Derivatives: Nucleophilic Acyl  Substitution Reactions
Chapter 22. Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions
Chapter 23. Carbonyl Condensation Reactions
Chapter 24. Amines and Heterocycles
Chapter 30. Orbitals and Organic Chemistry: Pericyclic reactions

Tutorials by TAs before each exam to explain the past exam papers, do not expect the level of past exam will be the same as that of the actual one you will be taking!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Sun
I rarely remember how he teaches, but I think they are somehow boring. You may refer to others for more detailed comments on his teaching.

Prof Nakamura
He is somehow humorous and uses some total synthesis as exercise to step-by-step explain the reaction he taught. There are also some ppt slides which he will talk but not upload to Canvas
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (40%) (Chapter 12-16 &19)
Final (60%) (All Chapters taught in the course)

In final exam, there are also some questions from CHEM2110 and Nobel Price winners.

Final Grade C+, better than expected
reviews.comment_workload: Although there is no assignments and quizzes, the workload is very high as you need to recite a lot of reactions. For final exam, I have written 12 pages of notes and I cannot remember all contents.

reviews.author: youdunknow
reviews.comment_content:
CHEM3120 is the second half of a two-semester, introductory level organic chemistry course designed for chemistry and biochemistry majors. The complete course will prepare students for further studies in organic chemistry and/or biochemistry.  Topics to be covered include IR, MS, and NMR spectroscopy; dienes, resonance and aromaticity; electrophilic aromatic substitution and nucleophilic aromatic substitution; benzylic and allylic reactivity; the chemistry of carbonyl compounds and carboxylic acid derivatives; the chemistry of amines; pericyclic reactions.

Topic:
- Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy
- Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
- Conjugated Dienes and UV Spectroscopy
- Benzene and Aromaticity
- Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution
- A Preview of Carbonyl Compounds
- Amines and Heterocycles
- Orbitals and Organic Chemistry: Pericyclic reactions
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Yong HUANG himself is very familiar with the mechanism and reaction, he taught about the reaction mechanism very thoroughly with drawings and videos from youtube. It's better to attend the class rather than studying ppt on your own.

Also, he will quickly reply to emails asking about the course content, so overall I think he's nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment, 10%
Online quiz, 20%
Final examination, 70%

sta:
Assignment:(100)
mean:73.04
high:97
low:0

Online Quiz:(100)
mean:43.69
high:85
low:20

Final:(300)
mean:89.04
high:244.5
low:13

my grade:A+
assignment:95
Quiz:70
Final:204.5

my grade
reviews.comment_workload:
quite a lot of mechanisms need to be memorized and most of the questions cannot be found in lectures notes since different reactants or products, students are required to understand the detailed mechanisms of the reaction rather than memorizing a specific example.

The final is very long, don't be scared if you can't finish, if you can get an overall 60% you will get an A.

reviews.author: SamSun
reviews.title: Many things to recite
reviews.comment_content:
Some basic introductions on org. chem. following 2110. Most about spectroscopy and carbonyl compounds and their basic reactions.
Also contains something about amines and pericyclic reactions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecture is a little bit boring as everything are on the PPTs. The instructor just read the notes at most time with little extending. And his voice is very monotonous. That may cause most students sleepy.
The class begins at 9am. , not a friendly time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just midterm and final, two exams. Homework are just for practice.
The instructor did not mentioned the grade distribution.
I have no idea about whether grading is good or bad because my grading rank is special.
Midterm 108/120, easy, most questions are from PPTs, 40%.
Final 173/180, some questions are a bit harder than midterm, 60%.
I got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a lot. Do have assignments. The assignments are the questions at end of each chapters on the textbook, no need to submit but it will be better to do them.
Just recite the PPTs then it’s OK to answer most questions in the exams even it might be boring.

reviews.author: Winnie the Pooh
reviews.title: Quite a good grade course for chem major
reviews.comment_content: Learn more about organic synthesis just like chem2110. Many things to recite but still in a manageable amount.
reviews.comment_teaching: Didn’t attend his lessons, I just read through notes before exams. He has an accent but not as bad as some other professors from mainland.
reviews.comment_grading: Lenient grading. My midterm and final scores are exactly the mean scores but I turned out to have a B. I thought it would be a B-/C+, I am very satisfied.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one midterm and one final. However, there is really a lot to recite not to mention that the syllabus of the final exam included the midterm part.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Two Steps from Hell
reviews.comment_content:
Before Mid-Term:

- Mass, IR & NMR Spectroscopy
- Conjugated Dienes & UV Spectroscopy
- Benzene & Hückel's Rule
----- Quiz ------
- Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution
- Acyl, Carbonyl, Nitriles & Carboxylic Acid Substitution Reactions

After Mid-Term:

- Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions
- Condensation Reactions
- Amines & Heterocycles
- MO Theory for Pericyclic Reactions
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor articulation.
Word-by-word reading from Powerpoints.
Hard to understand what he had put forward.
Loved filibustering in teaching.

Not quite a reliable teacher.

There were also in-class questions projected on the screen for you to think of. The answers were uploaded slide by slide on Canvas after every lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance is optional, but STRONGLY recommended.

Quiz (15%) - Mean: 63.5/100 (me: 57/100)
Mid-Term (35%) - Mean: 118.8/260 (me: 88/260.　WATERLOO !)
Final (50%) - Mean: 129.9/390 (me: 162/390)

One of the highest total marks I have ever seen in my twenty years of reception of education.

Final Weighed Total - Mean: 42.2/100 (me: 41.16/100)

Final Grade: B－
reviews.comment_workload:
Revision of lecture materials and self-practice questions (unmarked).

Make sure you could spare enough time to study this subject, or you could fail quite easily.

reviews.author: xdlok
reviews.title: Not a Chemistry Major, Just Audit
reviews.comment_content:
1. MS, IR, NMR, UV spectroscopy
Reactions of
- Benzene
1. Electrophilic Substitution
2. Aromatic Nucleophilic Substitution
- Carbonyl Compounds
1. Nucleophilic Addition
1.5 Acyl Substitution (acid derivatives)
2. Alpha-Substitution
3. Carbonyl Condensation Reactions
- Amines
- Conjugated Compounds: Pericyclic Reactions
1. Electrocyclic Reactions
2. Cycloadditions (Diels-Alder Reaction)
3. Sigmatropic rearrangements

There are a lot of reactions, but they are of similar mechanisms, so if helps a lot if you can understand them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching is just OK, he mostly read from the powerpoint slides, and sometimes draw on the whiteboard to illustrate things. His voice is quite soft though. He sometimes ask questions in class (although no one would answer except for one guy).

DO come to class tough, because some of the questions in class are quite important and they appear in the midterm and the final exam.
(P.S. I only skipped one class)
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
40% Midterm
Average: 98 out of 175
SD:  34
No Mechanism tested in the midterm for some reason?

60% Final
Average: 102 out of 262
SD:  60
The final are really difficult. I guess he left all the mechanism questions to the finals. And there are so many reactions that it may be hard to recall all of them in the exam.

Actually I am an auditor so I don't care about my grades at all. But I studied anyway (for like 2-3 hrs) before coming to the exam, and my results are:
Midterm: 136.5/175
Final: 192/262
and it seems that I would have got A as seen in canvas.
reviews.comment_workload: There are no homework at all. Although there are some assigned questions, those are for your own exercise only, and I didn't do any of them. In retrospect, that may have been quite useful, but what do I know.

reviews.author: LemonChow
reviews.title: my major is chemistry
reviews.comment_content:
Advanced organic chemistry knowledge about benzene ring, ketones, aldehydes, carboxylic acid derivatives, enols and enolates and amines.
The such knowledge including characteristics of such functional group, synthesis of organic compounds and the mechanism about nucleophilic and electrophilic reaction.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The notes is enough but you need to group the information about the similar mechanism to understand the reaction.
I just take the first lesson and I think the professor is not good at English? So, I skip all the lesson after that.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% in class quiz
35% midterm
50% final
both above mean around 1sd : B+
quiz mean 63.3/100
midterm mean 118.8/260
Final exam mean 129.9/400
reviews.comment_workload:
only quiz+midterm+final exam
There is a lot of information(more than 100 reaction).
I spent a lot of time in grouping the reaction.
It is hard for human beings to remember so the mean of all exam is very low.

reviews.author: andyasdfadfhadt
reviews.comment_content: 教既野幾實用 亦都好systematic 每堂講base on某d反應原則講10條8條反應 比org chem 1易明易背好多
reviews.comment_teaching: 聲音少少悶 不過講書清晰 英文無口音 問問題都答到 算教得幾好
reviews.comment_grading:
quiz同midterm幾淺 都同書exercise／past paper形式類似肯做肯溫就OK
係final忽然變難 詳細stat唔知 但係估grading都應該唔太差
reviews.comment_workload: 偏多 因為反應要背埋org chem 1 （～70條）＋org chem 2（～90條） 又要定期做書練習當溫習 記住要做熟d mechanisms 因為呢d對了解個principle再用係其他問題最有幫助 有時條mechanism特別得意計劃就要畫多幾次 背下咁

reviews.author: Hyeri
reviews.comment_content:
一開頭教各種spectrum，mass IR NMR，常見嘅建議背左佢

之後繼續reaction and reaction，不過困難度比org chem 1 升太多，alkanal alkanone acid加入戰團，仲要分electrophilic定 nucleophilic，真係將reaction玩到出神入化

以來quiz夠難，mid term又升lv，final 就真係打boss，少d心血到涯唔過
reviews.comment_teaching:
廢就算啦，仲要煩膠一個
教書＝讀notes
第一堂開始無耐已經冇人打算聽佢講野，之後第二堂之前就出封email話學生太吵，定規矩話嘈就趕人出課室，之後就冇乜人上佢堂

考quiz midterm仲搞笑，房本身就唔大，人就好多，大家明明坐好晒，又要話要隔開坐，搞勁耐先開到波，又要隔唔晒，分兩份卷又要其中一份印唔夠，搞到一d人遲過其他人先開始做卷

final check卷又一單，限入去check卷人數，一次8個人，原因話唔夠ta一對一喎，真係冇需要囉，頭果d人都等左半個幾鐘先有得入，遲果d都唔知等幾耐
reviews.comment_grading:
quiz midterm final總分大到嚇死人
15％ 35％ 50％
150分350分500分
final s.d.去到~100
mean有C+ to B-
reviews.comment_workload: 有心嘅做exercise，冇心嘅都起碼背晒所有reaction，雖然冇assignment，但係要溫嘅野真係好多

reviews.author: Wilder
reviews.comment_content:
相對Organ chem 1少好多,但係final要考晒成個SEM學過既reaction,而EXAM又真係有部份係專考MIDTERM前既野,所以真係要溫熟晒reaction
同埋考好多mechanism,盡量明白reaction ge mechanism可能會有用
reviews.comment_teaching:
基本上唔洗上堂
因為個PROF係完全跟PPT讀
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall 58.X% B
midterm mean:144/230 sd41
final mean:138/330
quiz 63/100 sd20

mean grade ~ B- to C+
reviews.comment_workload:
得quiz,final, midterm.
除左要記好多reaction之外其實workload唔大

reviews.author: phyllissssss
reviews.comment_content:
mainly about the introduction of 4 kinds of spectrometry, benzene, and carbonyl reaction. understanding the mechanism is important and useful, which will help you recite the reactions.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 12. Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy

Chapter 22. Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Sun teaches really slowly and quite a bit boring but still understandable and he adds some additional information to the lecture notes in the lesson.
Sample Midterm will be uploaded in canvas and the midterm paper will be distributed back to you.
He will upload the key of the midterm and talk about the midterm in the lecture right after the midterm.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Midterm examination, 40%
2. Final examination, 60%

reviews.comment_workload:
Not much. No assignments.
Not many reactions need to remember in the midterm.
However, the final exam is cumulative. It seems many reactions to be remembered.

reviews.author: holymama
reviews.title: 爛grade極致
reviews.comment_content:
Mass Spectrometry & Infrared Spectroscopy
Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
Conjugated Dienes and UV Spectroscopy
Benzene and Aromaticity
Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution
Aldehydes/Ketones: Nucleophilic Addition Reaction
Carboxylic Acids and Nitriles
Carboxylic Acid Derivatives: Nucleophilic Acyl Substitution Reactions
Carbonyl Alpha-Substitution Reactions
Carbonyl Condensation Reactions
Amines and Heterocycles
Orbitals and Organic Chemistry: Pericyclic reactions

Better to teach more in those name reactions such as Mannich reaction, favorskii rearrangement etc.
